author: {'steamid': '76561197984932547', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1461490226}
review:
Игра про "зомби" лезбиянок, 10 толерантных европейцев из 10.

А если серьезно игра не стоит не своих денег ( даже по скидки ), не времени потраченного на прохождение, даже с учетом что это от силы час. 
К плюсам, могу отнести, только приятную минимилистичную рисовку. ( и то одну героиню "исхудили" - другу "растолстили")

Минусы.
1 Сюжет убог и короток до жути - клеше на клеше. 
2 Сложность квестов заключается только в том что бы найти предмет спрятанный на столе  - то есть не какая. 

Если вы хотите купить игру по скидки ради карт, делать этого не стоит выбивать 8  карточек будете в 7 раз дольше чем проходить игру.

P.s. Не чего не имею против против зомби и лесбиянок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202896657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1453923826}
review: Sadly, I was disappointed with this game. It starts out very slowly, and right when it gets really interesting, it's suddenly over. As others already said, there is very little room to figure things out by yourself as the main character basically tells you the next step you should take while she is narrating. I also had problems with the cat part. Not even a trigger warning about it?? :( I almost wanted to stop playing because I got so upset. What happened was important to the storyline, BUT since the game has such a rushed ending, it felt pointless. The graphics are really nice, though, and I liked the story we read in the diary pages. I just wish that the letters were bigger, since it was really very hard to read! And to talk about the music: The track is nice, but gets really boring/annoying since it is the only thing you'll ever hear in the game. On loop. I do not recommend this game to anyone. Sorry. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198091959655', 'num_games_owned': 1347, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 10958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1470753344}
review:
[b]Belladonna[/b] it's an indie Point & Click game. That reminds those old legends of the mad scientists and their abominations [u](such as Frankenstein, The doctor Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, among others)[/u], themed with a gothic / horror atmosphere, belladonna would have been an indie game that you should own, i mean there are many facts that makes this game interesting:
[list][*] Great atmosphere.
[*] Visually friendly.
[*] Amazing background art.
[*] Nice background music.
[*] In-game story is so good, until certain point.[/list]

The story begins when you awake from an eternal dream [i](you are a re-animated corpse from which once was a girl)[/i], in a scientist laboratory. Without memories of your past or thoughts that what happened, during the walkthrough you will find notes that tell the true story about the place in where are you and you.

[h1]These points makes it just another failed attempt of a great game.[/h1]
[list][*] Voice acting is quite boring, i mean the voice of the girl is great, but the way that she talk don't.
[*] The game is too short.
[*] In-game hidden objects and objectives are too obvious.
[*] The final it's kind confusing. [/list]

Story would be great if it would be bigger and more difficult.

[b]Final score:[/b]
[b]★☆☆☆☆[/b]
Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025598384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1455026766}
review:
I try to buy indie games at or close to full price, particularly from first time developers who do something that looks cool or interesting. Sure, I've taken a bath on a couple of games that weren't as good as I'd hoped, but it's never been too punishing.

Until now.

Belladonna is the first game that I truly, [i]sorely[/i] regret buying. Even if I had a time machine and could go back and buy it dirt cheap, knowing what I know now, [i]I still wouldn't[/i]. As I write this review, it's currently on sale for sixty-nine cents and my brain is still going, "NOPE." Listen to my brain. It knows what it's talking about. Don't make the same mistakes I did. By all means, laugh at my pain, but save yourselves.

Ostensibly, Belladonna is a point and click adventure game consisting of exploration, a mystery narrative and puzzles. That assessment is...generous, at the very least. 

In a game that takes place in what's supposed to be a [i]castle[/i], there are about a dozen locations, [i]including hallways.[/i] Most contain one item--two if you're extremely lucky!--and maybe two or three short bits of flavor text so bland I hesitate to call it flavor text at all. If light vegan mayonnaise were flavor text, it's what you'll find here. I guess if you've never had anything else, it might seem robust, but I can't imagine anyone with half a dozen decent-to-good adventure games under their belts finding it anything but dull.

The narrative isn't much better than the flavor(less) text. The plot hinges on a mystery so transparent it's easily solvable after the first clue or two if you've got a couple of spare braincells lying around to rub together. Halfway through the story, you're likely to get fed up with how it's belaboring the point you've already figured out. “I know something you don't know!” the narrative teases, “Such a mysterious mystery! Oooh!” while you start drinking heavily and praying for the sweet release of death.

The prose is written in a style that I can only adequately describe as “olden time-y,” superficially reminiscent of Gothic literature if you tossed any old novel in a blender and diluted it with heavy doses of pretentious goth kid who swallowed a thesaurus but neglected to get enough dictionary in his diet.  This might not be so bad if the story and characters were stylish or over the top enough to carry the awkwardness—Hammer or Universal horror films are hardly historically accurate, but are cool enough you don't care—but Belladonna has the panache of a worn out shoe.

The story is told primarily through diary entries written by three different characters: the scientist, his socialite wife and the maid. They all sound virtually the same. The only discernible difference between them is that our Frankenstein writes in a slightly more ornate style and throws a few scientific terms around. I repeat: a socialite and a scientist both write the same way a maid does. In the Georgian/Victorian era. (Which is it? Who knows!)

The diary entries also contain only explicitly plot related bits with nothing else to really round out the characters. They're basically props to be moved around at the whim of the developer like little cardboard cutouts. This is not the way to tell a story with any hope of emotional potency. The villain gets what feels like three times as much “screen time” through the diaries as the two main characters we're supposed to care about—and he's dead before the story even starts!

Because the whole thing is written as telling rather than showing, in spite of the fact it's all plot, the relationships between the characters are barely touched on in any meaningful way. The main romance is written about in detail—as in, what actually happened between them during the course of their months long affair—in [i]one entry[/i]; it's given no development beyond that.

Character motives are thin on the ground. The writer tries to convey that the characters are driven by grief, but does so poorly that I'm not sure they've ever met and interacted with a real live human being. Since the story picks up [i]after both characters in question are through grieving[/i], their motivations appear for all intents and purposes to consist of such compelling reasons as, “Because science! I guess?” and “Because boredom! I guess?”

The puzzles would be insultingly easy to even the most casual of gamers over the age of nine. And though I may have blocked out the more excruciating aspects of the experience, as far as I can recall with the exception of the final one, they all have the same basic end goal: open a door/container. That's it. Kill a cat to open a door. Rifle through a dead body's pockets to open a box. Get a screwdriver to open a clock. Necessary items for solving these “puzzles” are often just left lying around in plain sight, require no extra steps to acquire them and no critical thinking to make them function. Can you put two and two together and not come up with “cheese”? Congratulations, you too can finish Belladonna!

Worst of all, [i]nothing happens[/i]. Nothing. Because everything has [i]already[/i] happened. This narrative device [i]can[/i] work in games (Analogue: A Hate Story managed to pull this off pretty handily) but the writing is so lousy that even the attempt is torture. After forty-five minutes of opening doors, it finally looks like something will happen!...and then the story cuts to black. The end!

If for some reason—masochism, morbid curiosity, a large iron spike in your head tickling the 'lack of common sense' centers of your brain—you're still considering shelling out dough to buy this, let me at least mention that the less story-based aspects suffer too in hopes I might dissuade you from such folly. 

First, the voice acting is dismal and one actor portrays both speaking characters: the first in a plain American speaking voice, the second with electronic distortion and a high school play English accent. Never mind that this apparently takes place in Eastern Europe or...Germany? (Much like the time period, who the fuck knows for sure??)

The diary entries are all written in fonts that border on unreadable to various degrees. They're either too flowery, too tiny, or joy of joys both.

It's bare bones in the extreme. There are no extras. No behind the scenes character art or similar unlockables. No achievements. [i]No save button.[/i] Now that's commitment to minimalism!

Replayability is nonexistent.

If after all this you still want the game, well...Godspeed, you beautiful, romantic fool. I envy your optimism, naivete and by the way would you like to buy a bridge in Brooklyn?

In closing, I will say: if Belladonna were updated in the future and whole swaths of it were rewritten, expanded and for the love of all that's holy [i]edited[/i], it might be something special, or at least an interesting if noble failure. Currently it is anything but. My playtime will be just long enough to collect all the cards and not a second longer.

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198099216008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1454798241}
review:
This game is cute, in a dark and twisted kind of way. I'd give it 5/10, and I recommend it only because it's 0,69€ now, and for that price it's a total catch.
PROS:
+ I loved the artwork and the general environment.
+ Music wasn't annoying, and voice acting was ok.
+ I liked the Steampunk vibe, the theme, and the story was cool.
+ References to Mary Shelley and Edgar Allan Poe, which made me squeal in delight.
+ Easy and logical, there is no constant backtracking, no pixel hunt, and no nonsensical inventory combinations.

CONS:
- Extremely short. I'm a VERY slow player, and I finished it in 2 hours, and that is including a pause I took for dinner while leaving the game on.
- Too easy. Not one puzzle and not one remotely challenging situation.
- The ending leaves lose ends, almost as if hoping for a sequel.

In short, if on sale, go for it. It's a nice hour and bit of a dark little story. But if you're into really challenging stuff, this one may bore you a bit. I still enjoy it and I'm not sorry I got it (then again, I got it for 0,69€).

author: {'steamid': '76561197992856756', 'num_games_owned': 3381, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1454805987}
review:
Un bon petit point n' click très très simple & très très court mais avec une bonne ambiance macabre.
En premier lieu, dommage car il se finit en moins d'une heure & demi (en prenant son temps) sachant qu'on en prends déjà la moitié rien que pour lire les pages de journals qu'on trouve à chaque écrans. (tout en anglais évidemment)
Les animations sont très rigides & basiques, il n'y a quasiment pas de cinématiques & il se fini abruptement sur un dessin...on a donc plus l'impression de joué à une démo...
Sinon le style graphique & sympathique, au style gothique & macabre en étant assez propre & basique sans être surchargé.
Au final, on aurait aimé qu'il soit beaucoup plus long & que ce ne soit que le premier chapitre d'une histoire plus longue telle l'athmosphère horrifique tout en restant cartoon à la Vampyre Story (sans le côté humoristique) qui s'en dégage est bonne...

author: {'steamid': '76561198160200174', 'num_games_owned': 1866, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1454659228}
review:
После прохождения этой игры, было непонятное ощущение. В общем, в двух словах: игра очень короткая, а для тех кто не больно любит читать, это покажется поистине сущим ужасом. Геймплея там на час-полтора, не более, а сюжет подвязан словно на основе какого-то бразильского сериала, по типу "А кто же убийца? Что кроется в записках? Был ли роман и как во всём замешана горничная?", что выглядит довольно таки забавно. А теперь перейдём к минусам. 

Далее в данном обзоре будут СПОЙЛЕРЫ, так что тем, кто хочет поиграть в данный "шедевер", лучше не читать (но коли вы любопытны, то продолжайте, всё равно там особо никаких интересных поворотов не будет, как по мне).
1 минус игры - убийство котика. Серьёзно? Так сложно обойти кота, чтобы проникнуть в комнату? Нет - надо его обязательно травануть, а прежде чем травануть, надо надыбать молока, цветок и смешать с отравой всю эту бадягу...вместо того, чтобы просто обойти кота. ГГ не ищет лёгких путей.
2 минус игры - записки. И дело даже не в том, что они на английском (проходила без русской локализации). Вся соль заключается в том, что разработчики игры посчитали неплохой идеей ввести разный почерк в повествование сюжета через них. Ведь подписанных сверху имён авторов этих самых записок недостаточно - надо подчеркнуть индивидуальность каждого. Поэтому было решено сделать хитров****нный почерк, которым, наверное, писали графы и герцогини в веке так XVII-ом, что немного усложняет процесс их прочтения и осмысления.
3 минус игры - концовка. Концовка игры обрывается моментально. Вроде бы всё ведёт к концу, но когда он по-настоящему настаёт, то приходится сидеть секунд 10 и не понимать, что произошло. И это не из тех концовок, которые заканчиваются и заставляют тебя восторженно охнуть, мол недосказанность и всё такое. Нет. Там просто финальная картинка и титры.
4 минус игры - её неоправданно высокая цена. Да, за 16 рублей её спокойно можно приобрести, но никак не за 169. Ладно бы, если бы продолжительность игры оправдывала полную цену, но нет и этого.

Моя итоговая оценка 4/10, потому что всё же в ней есть какой-никакой сюжет, прохождение не напрягает своими головоломками (хотя это успешно делают записки), если играешь для расслабления, а цена по скидке оправдывает игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165795845', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1454508657}
review:
Лучше прочитайте Франкенштейна
Первое что я заметил в игре это простая и в некоторых местах карявая рисовка и анимация, но стилистика игры выдержана нормально, есть атмосфера и даже появляется интерес пройти ее
Еще один минус игра короткая, просто ужас, я прошел ее за 58 инут это с тем что я отходил за чаем потом приходил и читал записки.
БАМ еще один минус геймплей сведен на минимум, из головоломок толко одна где как в детском саду нужно вставить кружок в кружок а квадратик в квадратик, весь геймпле состоит в том чтобы собирать вещи слушать мысли ГГ и иногда соединять вещи чтоб что то сделать, самое сложно что там есть это соединить 3 компонента да и то я не знаю у кого может это вызвать затруднения.и все время на кажой локации приходится читать записки в котором развиваються события до событий в игре.
сюжет прост и банален неожиданный поворот предсказуем
единственый плюс игры карточки которых можно получить аж 7 штук, но и то что они тут есть не получиться их получить за одно прохождение приходится ставить игру на ноь а на утро получать карточки
Не рекомендую, за такую цену можно купить Депонию чуть доплатив но в которую будет куда интереснее играть

author: {'steamid': '76561198072450805', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 799, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1454355221}
review:
Jednym zdaniem: Belladonna to feministyczna wariacja historii o Frankensteinie - autorzy otwarcie wzorują się na słynnej słynnej noweli Mary Shelley. Niestety gra, chociaż wizualnie jest bardzo atrakcyjna, to ma swoje wady i jest to bardziej... demo ciekawej gry niż pełna gra.

Pros:

+ atrakcyjny tytuł
+ piękna oprawa wizualna - strona graficzna przyciąga uwagę
+ ładnie zaprojektowane plansze z artystycznym zacięciem
+ dość ciekawy fabularny punkt wyjścia oparty na motywach opowieści o Frankensteinie
+ czarny humor w grze
+ przejrzysty interfejs
+ pod postaci są podłożone głosy audio (co w niskobudżetowych grach nie zawsze jest standardem)
+ karty kolekcjonerskie (aż 7)

Cons:

- gra jest wyjątkowa krótka (przejdziesz ją w 40 minut - to bardziej demo ciekawej gry niż gra)
- podłożone głosy nie są najwyższych lotów (zwłaszcza póżniejsza postać Belladonny)
- prezentacja fabuły w kartkach dziennika jest słaba (nie chce się tego czytać, bo czcionka jest zbyt mała i nieczytelna)
- baaardzo prosty poziom zagadek (gra jest super łatwa)
- fabuła de facto jest szczątkowa
- głupie zakończenie robiące z niepokojącej gry farsę
- zerowe replayability
- brak achivmentów
- niewykorzystany potencjał na mocną grę

Podsumowanie:

Belladonna to zaczątek dobrej klimatycznej gry przygodowej point and click inspirowanej historią Frankensteina. Niestety chociaż Belladonna wizualnie robi wrażenie, to twórcy podeszli do niej mało poważnie - gra, którą można ukończyć na 100 procent w 40 minut to jednak jakiś żart, zwłaszcza, że fabularnie kończy się dość idiotycznie,

Gra może spodobać się jedynie tym graczom, którym wystarcza jedynie strona wizualna. Innym graczom odradzam, zwłaszcza tym, którzy szukają w grze dobrej fabuły, bo na tym polu Belladonna rozczarowuje. W bardzo dużej promocji za kilkadziesiąt centów może warto, ale nawet wtedy gra zostawia wrażenie niedosytu... Szkoda.

Rada: Belladonna to 40 minut gry - nie lepiej obejrzeć za to ponad 120 minutowy dobry film o Frankensteinie? ;)

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198173074690', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1454174529}
review:
Belladonna - неплохая игра в жанре point & click. Довольно интересный сюжет, мрачная атмосфера, интересно выполненная графическая часть и музыкальное сопровождение. Однако у игры есть довольно существенные минусы.

Первый минус - длина сюжетки. Игру я прошла меньше, чем за полтора часа, учитывая то, что вчитывалась в записки, спокойно и тщательно все осматривала и даже местами тупила. Все остальное наигранное время я сидела в главном меню и выбивала карточки, которых должно выпасть аж семь штук. 

Сюжет игры нам передают через записки персонажей, в принципе довольно банально. Однако записки эти выполнены различными рукописными мелкими шрифтами, разными для каждого из персонажей, что показывает, что создатели старались, однако читать эти записки довольно затруднительно.

На самом деле игра очень даже хорошая, была бы она хотя бы на 3-4 часа геймплея, и если бы записки не были такими вырвиглазными, то цены бы ей не было. А так... Средненько. Честно сказать, своей цены она не стоит. (Но я покупала ее по акции с 91% скидкой, так что я всем довольна. Ну чего я еще могла ожидать за 16 рублей?)

Личная оценка - 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055528040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1454150178}
review:
My recommendation to play this game is based on the fact that I got it 90% off. Had I payed full price I'd be very angry right now. I love point and click games and the art style is lovely but this game is simply not worth full price. It took me an hour to beat and that's only because I got stuck and had to wander for a bit (didn't examine one of the rooms thoroughly enough). 

There were also no puzzles to solve which I could forgive had the story been better. It starts off interesting as there's a little mystery in who you are but then it kind of just fizzles. I would even suggest that the ending wouldn't be so bad if it were one a few options for endings? Not every game needs multiple endings to be good but I feel this one would benefit from it.

I did still basically enjoy my time spent but again, only because I got it on sale.


*MAJOR PLOT SPOILERS BELOW*


To be more specific, while I understand Belladonna's actions come from a place of grief, she's still a murderer and I had no desire to help her. (I also hate that I was forced to kill the cat, wtf?) I may have gotten behind her choice to build what is basically a zombie army had the game explored her reasoning more thoroughly but it seems like she's working out of vengeance and a desire to prove a point? Why no qualms about using Lucas's brain? Speaking of Lucas, I thought he was basically a baby when he died so what use would his brain be? Why can't Karla talk her out of it? 

Returning to my point of potential multiple endings, none of my questions were answered but they could be if there were multiple endings. One where you agree with Belladonna, one where you don't and leave/talk her out of her plans, and maybe one where you don't agree but can't talk her out of her plans and so you just wait for her to run down and throw her key in a lake or something. Seriously, this game has a lot of potential but basically feels unfinished especially since there's nothing else to do in the form of puzzles/hidden object areas that usually accompany point and clicks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084605790', 'num_games_owned': 1308, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1457476326}
review:

Something that tries to have those old point and click adventures feel, lacks in puzzles and length. Took me an hour to beat it and even though it made me curious about what the hell was going on, it didn't deliver.
I think some people might enjoy it but not at full price. It's short, the story is not that amazing even though it's not bad and it's really straight forward. No puzzles, no difficulty at all. Honestly… I can't just recommend it because it lacks in so many aspects even if in the end I was entertained for an hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098417443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1454186831}
review:
This game manages the feat of being both too short and too long.

How you may ask? 

In the first section of the game, if a 90 minute game can be said to have sections, your primary task is gathering journal pages. There are point and click puzzles, but to anyone who plays point and clicks, they pose no real obstacle. Anyway, the journals tell an interesting Frankenstein story that I would pay $1 or so for. I bought the game at $0.50, so at least I feel I got my money's worth.

After you finish reading the romantic horror story depicted in the journal, and wishing there was more story to read, the game takes a hard left turn to making a horrific undead army of mad science. The sudden tone shift is jarring. And then the sequence lasts barely 15 minutes, just long enough to lose the earlier focus, but not long enough to deal with the repercussions of such thinking.

For the most part, I don't recommend the game due to its lack of focus and short run time. But if you're bored and it's on sale, it's not the worst thing you could buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029230759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1454046876}
review:
This game is a short point-and-click adventuring type of game. There are no "real" puzzles to solve, but there's exploration and commentary from the protagonist. The nods to literary greats like Mary Shelley and Edgar Allan Poe were lovely, especially for bookworms like me! (There's also a character who is extremely reminiscent of the Bride of Frankenstein.)

The history and character information are fleshed out via journal pages/letters that you find while exploring. Each story is intriguing, with maybe one or two unexpected, little twists. While the style of the fonts were pretty, they were sometimes hard to read, but even I -- with glasses several years old -- read them just fine.

The music went well with the art style, and I appreciated some of the more dramatic moments. The voice acting was pretty good, not over-the-top or cheesy at all. Mechanics were easy and intuitive.

Overall, this is a great game for someone interested in a more casual point-and-click experience with a good amount of storyline. A bit short, but more than worth it for a sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209474620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1454063109}
review:
This one is a little hard to recommend. It was enjoyable but the ending just made it incredibly lacking.

[spoiler]This game would have benefitted with a little more interaction between Belladona and Klara. Maybe a scene where Belladona gives her a new dress? Maybe a little reminiscing between the two here and there? Maybe let Belladona follow us around and comment along Klara?  or maybe just show us what the new monster looks like at least. 
their relationship could be fleshed out some more.[/spoiler]
There's definitely a potential here if the game was just longer.

+ Beautiful artwork and backgrounds 
+ Wonderful Atmosphere
+ Likeable protagonist
+ The concept is interesting even if it fell short at times
? The music does the job, but I cant say its anything memorable

- Too easy, while I don't usually complain about dificulty, a little challenge with the puzzles would've been appreciated
- The stuff I rambled about 
- The font choices. How small it was. How I can't zoom in to read it better. The story is told mostly through the journals and reading it is the toughest part of the game. 
- How dare you make me do that to a cat

I'd recommend getting it at a discount

author: {'steamid': '76561197996354180', 'num_games_owned': 947, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1453902212}
review:
Belladonna has a few things going for it. The setting is well done, a nice old castle with big rooms, and the artwork is pretty good.  The small amounts of music included are decent as well, although the semi-jump scare reveal music tends to play over the other sounds, lessening it's impact. But the game has too many flaws and issues to recommend at full price.

First of all, it's incredibly short. I beat the entire thing in less than an hour and a half, and didn't push myself to go quickly. The extra time is from me letting it run overnight to get trading cards. The primary voice actor for your character is pretty good, but her voice doesn't match the creepy gothic environment. She sounds like a modern, 21st century female, not a recently brought back from the dead monstrosity. But that's not the worst of it. The second voice actor is atrocious, with a faux British accent that is poorly done and not consistently performed. Some of the sound effects are ridiculous. One of them is literally the AIM log on sound for a door opening. The environments feel fairly sterile; except for a few of the more elaborate rooms, most are barren and uninteresting, despite being well rendered.

The story isn't too complicated, and it's revealed mostly through journal pages you find scattered throughout the house you're exploring. There is a bit of mystery, but no major twist or huge intrigue once you figure out who the major players in the story are. It does weirdly go past what would be the natural conclusion, then turns around and ends much too abruptly. And the puzzles are all quite easy, with the protagonist often explaining what needs to be done through her commentary. It's annoying when you think "I knew that!" but don't get the full satisfaction of having figured it out.

Belladona isn't terrible, but it's not all that good. Still, it's frequently in bundles or hugely discounted, and it's worth a look if you can get it for a buck or less, as I did.

review:
Definate thumbs down.

Its a pixel hunter but its short, so that isnt a problem.

The puzzles are quite easy, so no head scratching there, which may/may not appeal to people.

It ends on a cliffhanger, dunno if the devs are still working on this game, no sign of them on the forum, which does not bode well, so if a cliffhanger doesnt appeal, then dont buy this game.

The story is told as you walk through rooms in a castle, collecting little notes that form a journal of sorts, depicting two sides of the story, its an interesting story, but due to the ending, there is no payoff. The writing is annoyingly small, making reading a bit of a chore.

BTW The game is about 90 mins long, but the developers have done some bogus programming that wont allow cards to drop untilnthe game has run for many hours, eg. DONT buy this game it will only encourage the devs to attempt another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1451652461}
review:
[h1]Belladonna est un jeu d’aventure flirtant avec le mythe de Frankenstein[/h1]

Une jeune femme se réveille dans un laboratoire. Qui est-elle ? Que fait-elle là ? Pourquoi elle a des rouages qui sortent de son corps ?

L’histoire se déroule dans un manoir. Vous allez découvrir avec différentes lettres qui se trouvent à travers la maison les tenants et aboutissants de l’histoire, mais sachez que c’est plein de rebondissements.

Je vous donne un indice pour l’histoire, il y a de grosses références à Frankenstein.

C’est un jeu d’aventure, mais il n’y a pas de mini-jeux qui entrecoupent l’histoire, résultat, en une heure trente, le jeu est achevé.

J’aime bien Belladonna même si je trouve que le jeu n’est pas complètement achevé. J’espère que l’auteur va se faire plaisir et nous faire plaisir en travaillant sur une suite.

Par contre, le prix sans aucune réduction est irréaliste, attendez des soldes !

[url=www.graal.fr/2016/01/02/test-belladonna-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire toutes mes impressions sur Belladonna.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198034820380', 'num_games_owned': 1748, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1453835592}
review:
IMO it's certainly not worth full price, I only paid 69 cents for it and I'm glad that's all I paid.   I can forgive a game when it's short (here it's about 45mins clicking on everything and taking my time) if there is something about it that it so unique, compelling, fun or just a wonderful story.  Sadly here it doesn't deliver on any of these.

Yes the artwork is beautiful, but very few scenes to admire. There is a character voiceover and  I loved how the story unfolded through journal entries.  The story starts out very promising if predictable but instead of continuing and ending on a more poignant note, from out of nowhere it descended into a silly farce that wasn't witty or funny enough to pull it off even if your like that type of story.

I don't even mind that there were no puzzles or even that it was so easy if there was something else to focus on but the story alone wasn't strong or good enough to carry it.

The one thing that really annoyed me and I feel I shoud warn people that would care about animal cruelty/distress in games is that you have to [spoiler]  kill a cat.  [/spoiler] I hate when DEVs do this as there is never any need, it doesn't further the story despite later trying to make a point that there was. 

When you look at everyone's game times do note that there are 7 card drops which takes a long while to drop.  I have no idea who I could recommend this game to, so I won't recommend it to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053788131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1453772038}
review:
Belladonna is a strange game, although at about an hour of play time one should really call it a 'short'. It assumes the guise of a typical point-and-click adventure game, but the puzzles are much too easy and I spent as much time reading the in-game 'letters' (journal pages) as I did playing the game. I guess it's best described as a cross between a visual novella and a short adventure game. Regardless of how one might best categorise it, I found it somewhat lacking at the end, and it left me thinking, "Now what?"

The plot is interesting, very much like Frankenstein, as you will already have gathered from the Steam game page's description, but isn't followed through to a satisfying resolution. It's almost as if the developers ran out of time and finished it before they'd really got into their stride. Certainly in the short timeframe in which you'll play the game -- it took me 67 minutes to complete the game; the rest of my Steam-reported game time is idling for the remainder of the trading cards -- there's no opportunity for in-depth character development or anything but the most obvious plotline.

The graphics are good: cartoony, with an attractive visual style reminiscent of many point-and-click adventure games. The main character is reasonably well animated and the title screen is particularly attractive. The few still images present in the game are well done as well.

Sound is so-so. Music is good and sets the mood for the game. Voices are not so good. Or rather, they're okay, but don't fit the characters at all well. The main character sounds like a well-spoken, but somewhat pretentious American teen, whereas the other voice (yes, there are only two in the game) is a bit mumbly and not so well spoken. Given the roles they are meant to represent, the voices really don't fit.

So, overall, I was disappointed by Belladonna. I had expected more than what I received, but what was there was, on the whole, pretty good. It's just a shame there wasn't more. It doesn't really offer anything new, but it is quite nice all the same.

I recommend it, but with the caveat that you should take into account the very short play time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214213240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1453781827}
review:
Belladonna's main flaw is its length. This is a short game, even factoring in the puzzles (which are fairly simplistic and easy to figure out). The story itself felt a little rushed because of this; I could have played a MYST-style game with this story if it had been more fleshed out and with more puzzles to explore. However, for the price I paid for the game (I bought it on sale), I felt I received what I deserved from it.

Otherwise, I rather enjoyed this game. It's got this gothic romance vibe that borrows from the works of Poe and Mary Shelley. The artwork is minimalistic for the characters, but it allows for the player to appreciate the work that went into the backgrounds. I liked the story, but again, I wish there was something more substatial to it. The protagonist was likable and easy to form an attachment to, despite how short the game is. 

I would recommend this game to anyone interested in puzzle games who also like macabre, gothic plot points and themes being explored.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994746985', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1453774390}
review:
As Edgar Alan Poe himself once defined "A short story should be read in a single sitting". If there is ever a way to define a "Short Story" in  video game form, a screenshot of this game will be right there, illustrating the definition, since one sitting is all that it takes to finish it. as of this writing, I had logged only 1.4 hours into the game  (probably going to add a bit more, since there is still one item to get).

That, is at the same time its best and worse feature.

If you consider this game a short story, its for the best. Its a small tale of lost love and love beyond death. there is no big developments or big twists. you character is the center of the narrative and uncovering what happened to you makes the story goes foward. small as a short tale should be. 


But, specially because of the whole inspiration from Frankenstein, you can't help to wonder what if the developers decided to do a Novel instead of a short story. what if we could see each and every detail of how that final illustration came to be. what if there was more! in that regard, being so short takes from the enjoyment, specially if you consider most playthroughs are supposed to last more than 1 hour.

other than that, the game tells too much instead of showing, but that is a problem even with AAA games out there. being a bit heavy on exposition does makes to comparisson to a short story or novel stronger tough.

on the sound department, its excelent. the soundtrack does convey the right mood at the right time. perfect. nothing much to add.

Graphicswise, its competent. The characters could use a bit more animation, but once you realize what they are supposed to be, the point becomes moot. but even for a abandoned mansion, the place looks rather empty.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970648294', 'num_games_owned': 1394, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1452813543}
review:
[h1]In short:

If you're a fan of old school click and play (point and click) titles you might find Belladonna to be disappointing. Not because it deviates from norms set by the classics but because it doesn't even try. If you've read the other reviews stating the shortness to be a good thing, well then imagine a game that's not even an hour long, has a very corny story, disappointing abrupt end and has no puzzles to be solved at all.[/h1]

[h1]In long: [/h1]

That's right. There are no puzzles left for the player to solve. The only ones you encounter are either so simple or outright explained and solved by the protagonist herself as she speaks to herself, leaving you no room to experiment or even ponder what you ought to be doing. I've never played an adventure game this easy in my life unless you count games targeted to toddlers with similar game mechanics. I would argue those games to be even more cerebral experiences than Belladonna.

The staple, the hallmark of a good adventure game to me has always been that they force the player to think outside of the box. A constant effort must be made by the player to figure out what to do. Careful and most importantly thoughtful game design is needed to keep the player entertained in these type of games. That combined with a vivid and interesting story, a deep mystery, or simply a protagonist that is interesting / quirky and full of character are also very important in a genre that only uses the left mouse click to play it. Belladonna has none of that. There is a mystery there but it's not meant to be solved. The game simply makes you read journal pages that explain it and that's it. The only difficulty in the game is finding an item (if you even missed it -- they are very easy to find) or trying to read the journal pages as the font is set to be so small it makes your eyes bleed.

The only positive I can give to the game is the art design. It's hard to explain just how little is in this game though. In the store page there are 7 backgrounds shown. The game only has about 12 of them, so it basically shows you over 50% of the game's scenery right there. There are also no cutscenes. Sometimes the game just fades to black and we get to hear sounds as if they couldn't finish the game or the artist couldn't bother drawing vital scenes in the game. I mean the entire ending has no cutscene at all. It just fades to black, we hear a few corny lines and then we get to see someone's doodle with the words "The End" on it.

The music is good. The very little there is. I mean I can't complain about it so my only memory of it is that it didn't bother me. It sets a tone and keeps it there. The voice acting is ok. You won't be moved by the characters at all since they are devoid of any. I can't blame the voice actors at all as the writing seems very corny. The game sets a good atmosphere at first in the beginning, but immediately breaks it by having joke descriptions when you inspect objects more than once (a staple in adventure games yes -- but very out of place in the games milieu). If you establish that the main character is a "tabula rasa" an empty slate, but then she makes quirky Monkey Island esque remarks, you just destroyed all the character you worked so hard to establish right of the bat.

[b]Final thoughts (and story spoilers):[/b]

Belladonna is a game that falls flat I'm afraid, unless all you're after is a short novel length story that's only twist is the protagonist discovering a note that tells her she was a lesbian when she was alive and the lover of the only other character in the game and that's it. That's it! No character arc, no nothing. It's disappointing because it's established early on that she has no memories, no personality and possibly no emotions at all and is basically an empty slate. Yet she reads a note left by her living self and instantly she's now the person she used to be I guess. 

It would've been so much more interesting if the game actually played with these concepts rather than just introduce them and then take the short route out. The game could've made strong statements about sexuality and the human persona, what it is to be a human and to exist. But it doesn't. It just says "o-oh... I'm a lesbian? L-lewd!" and then gives you an ending drawing out of a b-movie with the main character in a slave esque pose under another woman like she just accepted it no problems at all. The game begins "tabula rasa" and ends "tabula rasa".

The most disappointing fact is that the game teases with a lot of good philosophical questions and hints at many possible interesting side effects of what it might be like to be a reanimated human being. But then it doesn't even explore them. It's like there's two lines of the main character pondering about possibly being a sociopath after killing a cat and then talking about it with another character and then this is entirely forgotten. The ending of the game is also insanely cheesy and left me even more disappointed.

I can't recommend this game to anyone. Sorry.

Twitch / Celgaming

author: {'steamid': '76561198114742602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1452222351}
review:
游戏时间比较短不到2个小时(但为了挂卡估计要挂10个以上吧) ,而且还是所有笔记都看完的情况下.整体来说解开谜题的难度很低,几乎不会遇到卡住的地方.剧情还是蛮有意思的,发疯的科学狂人,相当于守寡的女主人,剩下的唯一的女仆,自行联想吧....笔记分三部分,分别从3个人的角度来叙述城堡里发生的事情.
游戏素质虽然还是可以的,音乐虽然循环,但营造小紧张和诡异气氛的感觉还是有的,风格属于有点诡异,略恐怖却又带着一点点黑色幽默的那种,结局有点恶搞,总觉得应该是和哪个游戏或画作有关,而且也算是最后贴了下流行的僵尸元素.脑子,脑子,脑子....
当然最后说说价格,原价28,虽然游戏尚可但不建议直接入手,确实太短了而且没有任何分支,玩完了挂完卡(一共15张能挂出7张..) 不会有重玩的意义和动力.,..等福利了再说吧,,,另外游戏本身没有设置选项,不能调整音量,分辨率,窗口化什么的,有点不人性化啊....整体打7分吧,游戏8分价格6分...

author: {'steamid': '76561198022076168', 'num_games_owned': 3605, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1450817995}
review:
Belladonna é uma pérola indie e uma grande homenagem tanto aos antigos "scummvm games" (ou adventures point and click como ficaram conhecidos por aqui) quanto aos filmes de terror clássicos (a referência à Frankenstein é bem óbvia na verdade).

Você no controle de uma garota-cadáver recém acordada de uma mesa cirúrgica deve explorar uma mansão sombria atrás de pistas do seu passado, morte e reencarnação. É um game que te prende pela história simples, porém extremamente bem contada, do começo ao fim.

Pena ser meio curto, em pouco mais de uma hora você completa a história sem grandes dificuldades, e o game não tem nenhum valor de replay. Apesar disso, o final do jogo te deixa bem empolgado para uma eventual continuação.

Se você é fã de adventures clássicos, como Indiana Jones & The Temple of Atlantis, The Dig, Full Throttle, Sam & Max, Day of the Tentacle e outros, definitivamente deve pegar Belladonna em uma eventual promoção da Steam (R$ 13,99 por um jogo de uma hora é um pouco pesado).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025266541', 'num_games_owned': 3504, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1451699344}
review:
Uwielbiam gry point & click. Uwielbiam rysunkową grafikę. Uwielbiam tzw. "gothic". Słowem, zakochałem się w Belladonnie. 
Wcielając się w postać ożywionej niczym potwór Frankensteina piękności, próbujemy rozwiązać zagadkę: kim i gdzie jesteśmy. Prawdę mówiąc z początku miałem mieszane odczucia co do tej gry. Muzyka, styl graficzny, bardzo dobry (angielski) dubbing w wykonaniu jednej aktorki urzekły mnie niemal natychmiast. Zawiodłem się natomiast sposobem przedstawienia fabuły, gdy już w pierwszej lokacji zobaczyłem fragment dziennika, który oczywiście był ścianą tekstu. Od zawsze mówiłem, że jest to najgorszy z możliwych sposobów narracji. Belladonna jednak tak właściwie opiera się na zbieraniu i czytaniu opowieści innych postaci ze świata gry. Mimo to wciągnąłem się w tę historię niesamowicie, już po drugiej znalezionej kartce pragnąłem wiedzieć więcej. To bardzo dobrze pomyślana historia, która niestety, szybko się kończy (tak, tak, te moje 9 godzin wynika z kilkukrotnego jej przejścia, a i tak jeszcze musiałem trochę odczekać by zdobyć karty), sprawia wrażenie raczej prologu do czegoś większego niż pełnej gry. No cóż, średnio ogarniętemu graczowi powinna zając ok. 1,5 godziny. Mimo wszystko, moim zdaniem warto, ale w przecenie. 7€ to faktycznie wysoka cena za tak króciutką opowieść.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998238193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1451776153}
review:
This game is bad.  Bad bad.  Almost as bad as a game can be while lacking glitches.

The character art is atrocious.  Who has a neck that freaking long!?  There are only two characters in the game (apart from the ludicrous end image) and I can only assume they were reanimated through silly putty.
The voice acting is just terrible.  Well, alright, it's more fair to say that the acting is completely out of place for this setting, and the same goes for the script itself.  "This oil looks expensive.  Let's waste it!"  No.
The music is... fine, until it decides something dramatic happened.
The story itself is fairly good until you reach the climax, after which it's all downhill.
I can say that the background art is good.  The gothic style is very well done, but unfortunately there is pixel hunting to be done for some of the necessary items, which is never fun.
The game is short, only 70 minutes for me without stopping, even when I clicked everything I could find, as I always do for P&C games.

I hate writing bad reviews.  But this game has it coming.  Seriously, no one thought the main character's design was flawed?  No one?  No one said "What the hell's wrong with her neck?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198086651902', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1529921924}
review: I liked this game. The story was dark, though a little too straightforward. Everything is revealed within the first half an hour or so of playing. All in all, it took me about an hour or so to beat this game, with the game leaving me unsatisfied. This didn't feel like something worth what it was priced at, only because of the length. The art style was haunting and beautiful, and the story was something special. Yet, the puzzles were few and far between, with some extrodinarily simple answers. All in all, the game left something to be desired, yet I will be looking for more things by the developers. From what I can see, this was their first game, at least on Steam. All in all, it's worth a play, if only for the story.

review:
It is an interesting game. It has intriguing, solid plot. It has good atmosphere (though it's not truly scary). Gameplay is very simple, same goes for puzzles, you shouldn't have any problems with it, even if that's not your thing. But...

It's short. And I mean really short. Don't look on my gameplay time, I think you can safely finish this game during one hour, maybe one hour and half. And I don't think the ending is really satisfying. So is it worth the full price? I don't think so. But if you have an option to buy it cheaper or as a part of a bundle, I can definitely recommend playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996212067', 'num_games_owned': 3642, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1451551482}
review:
I initially installed that game just to check it out briefly before uninstalling it. The screenshots were not particularly impressive and the video pictured a relatively badly animated character. Yet, after only a few minutes of play, I got hooked by the backstory, explained by notes scattered here and there in an obvious way, which makes them easy to spot, which is a good thing so you don't miss any and can discover the intrigue unfloding in the right order, with the intended tension.
In the end, I completed the game in one session, delaying my sleep for as long as possible, wanting to know what the next note would reveal about the characters. The puzzles are fairly easy, and that's not a bad thing in my opinion, you are not stuck in one place for too long and you can enjoy the story without being frustrated.
No achievements sadly, but the game comes with trading cards.
I highly recommend that title, especially for this price. This was a very pleasant surprise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079857493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1450763749}
review:
I'm going to be generous and recommend this game, with the SERIOUS caveat that you only bother buying it at a good sale price, and only if you really like inventory-based point and clicks and want to play a different one. The two main reasons for this are that it's incredibly short... And very, very easy--you can more or less complete it first time at the same speed you might in a second playthrough. I always mess about going back and forth all over games in my first playthroughs to see if there are Easter eggs to be found, even when it's so obvious what the next move is, and in this game it is always obvious, not just because the puzzles are easy, but they're also signposted in the dialogue.

Its good points are as follows:

- interesting storyline/nicely written, if a little (read a lot) derivative
- reasonable voice acting
- nicely drawn backgrounds
- a sense of vague mystery as to the identity of your protagonist
- a nice game to get the uninitiated into adventure games

So I'm ever the optimist, wishing to support adventure games wherever possible, especially indie efforts. But here are the cons, for the more initiated, which I'm afraid outweigh the pros and this part contains SPOILERS, so be warned:

- such a short game, I almost feel like I could have completed it within half an hour on my first try if I wanted
- very dissatisfying ending
- only two NPCs with which you can interact, and one of them doesn't talk. A third NPC is dead, if that counts
- the puzzles are so easy your average seven-year-old probably wouldn't struggle
- I've seen better background animation
- I've seen better characterization
- it's non-sale price is ridiculously high for what the game offers
- not a particularly original storyline
- protagonist walks so slowly, at least something that increases game time but one of my pet hates
- not many explorable areas
- hardly any meta (at most I think two observations per object)
- virtually nothing you can observe/comment on that's not essential to completion
- virtually no humour
- did I say this game is short and far too easy?

So I did enjoy it as an adventure-game hoarder, but can't recommend it to all. I do however, know how difficult it is to produce an adventure game, especially independently, and it is quite a polished effort when you consider that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073671235', 'num_games_owned': 2413, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1450804057}
review:
Belladonna ist eine schöne Geschichte basierend auf "Frankenstein".
Der Spieler erwacht in einem Labor als wiedererweckte Gestalt und macht sich auf den Weg herauszufinden was mit ihm (bzw ihr) passiert ist.
Dabei sammelt man Notizen, welche einem Aufschluss darüber geben, was passiert ist. Nebenher löst man noch Rätsel, in dem man in bekannter Manier Dinge aufnimmt, kombiniert und wieder verwendet.
Belladonna bietet in dieser Hinsicht zwar keinerlei Neuheiten, ist aber dennoch angenehm zu spielen, hat keine Fehler und ist schön anzusehen und schnell verständlich.
Leider etwas kurz für eingefleischte Adventure-Spieler.
Die Geschichte ist etwas makaber (wie bei Frankenstein zu erwarten), allerdings ist bis auf etwas Blut und das Vergiften eines Tieres keine sichtbare Gewalt im Spiel.

Positiv:
+ Optisch sehr schön
+ Interessante Geschichte
+ Leicht zu bedienen
+ Handlung klar und fließend
+ Keine Bugs / Glitches
+ Sprachausgabe (bis auf längere Texte (Notizen))
+ Sammelkarten

Negativ:
- etwas kurz, daher ist der Preis doch stattlich
- keine Achievements (wären für bestimmte Abschnitte nett)

Trivia:
- Referenz zu Mary Shelly's Frankenstein
- Ein Rabe (Edgar Allen Poe) sitzt auf einer Büste über der Türe

Fazit:
Bis auf die kurze Spielzeit ein gelungenes Spiel. Wenn es im Angebot ist oder in einem Bundle kommt, unbedingt zugreifen!

7/10 würden Beladonna in Ihrer Bibliothek zum Leben erwecken!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035967140', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1449730470}
review: As someone who has been playing adventure games since the 80's, the puzzle side of this was rather lacking.  On the positive side, everything you do is somewhat intuitive, which is always a plus for a point and click adventure.  I loved the voice acting of the POV character and found her to be quite interesting and not annoying.  I only wish that, upon the first time you read any journal entry, you heard her thoughts on the piece immediately afterwards rather than simply refering back to it when clicking on certain objects.  I also like that some object descriptions change throughout the course of the game.  All in all, I would say that this is worth playing, yet it could have been expanded for an even better experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001328072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1449307662}
review:
Belladonna is a short re-narration of Mary Shelley's Frankenstein presented in a classic Point&Click fashion.

By 'short' I mean it took me only 1.8 hours to complete the game.
Although the story is interesting it might make some players feel uncomfortable at times,
as it features a lesbian romance which involves the death of your former husband, the need to break open a sarcophagus and decapitating the corpse inside with a bonesaw, etc. What I personally disliked the most, is that you have to kill a cat in order to proceed...

Aside from that Belladona is quite an enjoyable experience. The difficulty is easy, as most of the puzzles are very straight-forward and require just a minimum of logical thinking. So the game felt more like an interactive storybook to me than a classical point&click adventure, a fact that I liked. The voice acting was great, too, as it suited the main character especially well. The plot is transported through various notes scattered around the game environment, while being perfectly fine to me, some players might prefer the story to be shown to them...
What I also noticed is, that the spelling of some characters' names is not consistent,
meaning that the same person is sometimes called 'Franziska', another
time it's 'Franzeska'. Not sure if I got something wrong there, though...

So, if you are looking for a decent but short adventure (and if you can cope with the above-mentioned twists), this is a game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977497555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1448747893}
review:
[h1] Story [/h1]

Belladonna is a gothic and dark adventure game. You play with a corpse girl rising from the dead in an abandoned castle, trying to discover the mysteries concerning her death and reanimation. 

[h1] Graphics & Atmosphere [/h1]

Hand-drawn graphism really beautiful, with a lot of details, a sucessfull creepy atmosphere and nice music work. I really enjoyed to elvolve in this particular world.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

It's a pure point-and-click with a few easy puzzles to solve and collect journal pages all over the castle to know more about your story. More a reading game than adventure one.

[h1] The Good [/h1]

- Really good atmosphere and world
- Nice story 

[h1] The Bad [/h1]

- Extremely short. It deserves to be longer, with more areas to discover, puzzles to solve... The end of the game invites us to hope for more, like a prologue.
- Too easy gameplay

I recommend this game because it was nice to play, unfortunatly, not developped at its full potential. More episodes will be appreciated but i don't know if developpers have plan for it.

review:
Вы играете за девушку - Франкенштэйна, котороя очнулась в лабораторной палате, и не помнит что и как сней произошло.

Визуально, Белладонна очень простой по себе квест, как и другие игры головоломки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077635337', 'num_games_owned': 1466, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1447288481}
review:
The protagonist kills a cat because it was in her way, instead of finding a better option: -1,000,000/10

Seriously though, this game is really overpriced for something that can be finished in 15 minutes. While the story is somewhat enjoyable (a pleasant variation on the classic tale by Mary Shelley), it is hardly satisfying.
I have to admit, the whole experience was seriously lacking - the music was barely noticable, the voice acting was average, the artstyle was okay-ish, animation was stiff and minimalistic (in the negative sense of this word). Also, human(oid) characters were simply, ekhm... indifference inducing? I actually find it quite surprising how little I cared about what they feel and say in comparison to the fate of aforementioned kitty-cat. Poor thing.

Honestly, I cannot recommend this game to anyone. Maybe, just maybe, you could pick it up after discount or in a bundle, if you like the style or are a fan of Frankenstein. Otherwise, you might end up really disappointed and frustrated.

review:
A nice adaptation from the classic Frankenstein. The puzzles are not absurdly overwhelming, actually they were quite simple, but still enjoyable. The art is beautiful, with the steampunkish twist of clockworks and galvanic experiments. 
The story could have been explored in more depth. The game ended up being too short and quick-paced, sometimes it sort of skipped things over when the progression of the story would have been more enjoyable if time was given to build the atmosphere.
I think the developers could have worked a little better in the storytelling to fix the "hurried" feeling of some scenes, but still I enjoyed it greatly and will definitely be playing again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084395598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1446956910}
review:
One thing I'll mention at the start is that there is a spoiler at the end of this review, I wouldn't usually but I'm pointing out a massive flaw in the story, so it's somewhat unavoidable.

Ultimately, the game is cheap, and as I got it in a bundle it cost me pennies, so I can't really hate it. For the price, it's probably about what I'd expect. It's a nice way to kill time for an hour, and once you start playing, you'll want to finish purely to confirm that your guess is correct regarding what happened. That doesn't mean it deserves a recommendation though.

The biggest problem I had with the game was the length. You can probably complete this in an hour, or 2 if you're like me and a) can't see for toffee and continually walk past one of the items tens of time, and b) spend half of it looking for secrets, of which there are none. The story progresses very quickly, and although it's interesting, it loses points for it's inability to keep you in anticipation of the ending. Not even half way in, and you can guess easily enough what happened.

It also isn't difficult. I didn't read anything about the game when I started, so I wasn't too sure what I was getting myself into, but I expected jump scares and hiding from a murderer or something along those lines, but there's none of that. There are technically puzzles in it, but they are so obvious that they require no thought. The items are easy to find, (though there was one that I just couldn't notice for a while), so most of them you're likely to have picked up on your way through already, so there isn't a lot of back tracking like you would expect for a game like this. The entire area you can explore is very small as well.

Another big one for me was the voice acting. The voices didn't match the characters, and they truly sounded staged. I don't know who did the voices, but it sounded like they picked someone random from the street, or perhaps the game makers used their own voices. It was off putting.

The ending was also rushed. You'll have everything already once you get the final objective, with the exception of one item which is already explained to you how to get, so you don't even need to work for it. You get them, do the thing, and it's suddenly over. The ending truly was not satisfying at all.

One thing I did like was the artwork, it suited the story quite a lot, though it could have been animated a lot better.

It's unfortunate that the ending wasn't really set up for a continuation, at the length it is it'd be better if it was just one chapter of a larger story. This game would be vastly improved if they increased the playing time, added a lot more exploration, added some difficult puzzles, and perhaps a mad murderer you had to avoid to keep you on your toes.

SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER 



There was one thing that bugged me in this. You get a key from the dead body of the husband. The key unlocks a box containing another key. That key is used to wind up the wife. The wife says the reason she couldn't wind herself up is because the key on her back is placed out of her reach, so only someone else can wind her up. This suggests that she had access to the key. Then why did she lock it up and put the smaller key on the husbands body, whome she hated? It makes no sense. It'd perhaps make more sense if she just changed the line to: "I couldn't wind myself up because I didn't have access to the key", but if she had time to do the experiment, wouldn't she at least have time to look for the key on the corpse?

And since I'm spoiling anyway, there's another annoying thing about the story. The maid wrote a note suggesting she was falling out of love with the wife, but if you try to mention it to the wife, she decides against telling it in the end. If you put something like that in, you should at least expand on it, otherwise it feels completely pointless. Even just a simple alternative ending, like a good ending if she stays quiet, and a bad ending if she doesn't. With the ending being just one still image, all that needs to be done would have one more image as an alternative, and it'd tie up a lot nicer than it currently does.

Anyway, that's my review of the game, I'll won't be recommending it, but honestly if it's on offer for a quid or part of a bundle or something, they I'd at least consider it.

review:

review: This is a basic point-and-click adventure with an captivating story and interesting characters, but it's too short for you to really get to know them deeply. However, I genuinely enjoyed this game despite the length being only an hour. I would be overjoyed if it had been longer with more puzzles/tasks/exploration in between easy to find letters that unravel the tale. The ending felt a little abrupt too, but gosh I still love this. Perhaps get it on sale to make up for its length, but don't forget about it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141404871', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1447186848}
review:
This point and click game is a rather unique recreation of 'Frankenstein or The Modern Prometheus' by Mary Shelley with all the thought provoking moral and ethical drama of the original.  This game is a STORY; heard through the poignant remarks and observational thoughts of the lead character and (OMG the horror) READ through journal notes.  There are 18 notes total, 9 by Dr. Wolfram von Trauerschloss (Trauerschloss means Mourning Castle in German) 5 before and 4 after the reanimation of his wife, 4 by his wife, Belladonna while she was alive, 4 by Belladonna after she is reanimated, and 1 by her faithful servant, Klara Seiber.  Part point and click, part visual novel, part walking simulator, part horror, part mystery, part commentary and ALL ABOUT THE STORY BEING TOLD from different perspectives and points of view.  That is tough to do in only 18 journal pages and those 18 pages get the job done, and done very well.

Most reviewers state that this is a short game and it is.  I finished in 119 minutes (and I am slow) but was quite satisfied by the story told.  It was like reading a short story or novella.  The end was a bit truncated I thought and not seemingly appropriate until thought about.  Yet how else could it have ended but the way it did.  The epilogue is a single screenshot the credits play over, and picture shows everything that needs to be stated.  

Reviewers complain about having to READ.  Really? Seriously?  18 handwritten journal pages are too much??  And 1 has only a few words on it.  Plus the questions/dialogue near the end that explains so much motivationally, ethically, and morally. That was too much to read??? (Sighs in disbelief and shakes head).

There are no puzzles.  (Really there are none despite other reviewers saying there are.)  It is a straight linear STORY with little inventory that reveals itself and characters as the game progresses.  It is not even an adventure but it had to be put is some category other then horror, I suppose.  

Worth the READ because this game is more of a STORY than anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121570681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1458182456}
review:
I played this without looking at the description. I thought the protagonist is, like, a robot-type version of a Frankenstein (the art sure looked like it), but it turns out, she's a reanimated corpse. LOL. 

+ Pretty art details
+ Chilling music
+ Interesting 'investigative' story
+ Simple and fun to play; story kept it interesting.

- Gothic and twisted? Sure. Horror? Not so much.
- Text heavy (in journal, which you have to read to fully understand the situation).
- Voice acting is a bit off. Not sure if that was intentional (given the premise) but the characters sounded cold.
- Too short for a $7 price tag. Completed it in about an hour. Anything more would be to idle for cards.
- Very abrupt ending. Story seemed rushed. 

I got this from a bundle. I wouldn't recommend getting it at full price ($7) due to the length (~ 1 hour) of the game. Otherwise, it's good for when you have an hour to kill.

My Rating: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972548918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1446034205}
review:
A beautiful story of love, loss and reanimation. It's got enough twists to keep you guessing, though by about half way through you've got the general idea figured out. 

I personally got this little gem as part of a bundle, and I really enjoyed it. But be warned, it is -short-. I've just completed it whilst at work in a few hours (which means that time includes interruptions). The 'puzzles' are easy, and your antagonist actually explains most of what to look for herself.

That said, the artwork is beautiful, the story is complex and well written and you really do find yourself caring for the characters, even if by the end you're a little unsettled by the whole thing. I got the impression that this could have been increased for multiple endings/different finales - but perhaps that was just me.

All in all, well worth a play through, perhaps even more than once with a bit of time between. I'd recommend if you like dark stories and a bit of mystery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006541362', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1446030282}
review:
You wake up as a reanimated corpse in a laboratory with no memory of who you are or what has happened: you set out to uncover your identity and, reading a journal page you find nearby, you start to uncover the sad, sordid story of the place.
Belladonna is a very short point and click adventure with gothic and dark elements sporting a good story but sadly lacking in gameplay and length.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-the dark art style is quite good 

-atmospheric sound design backed up by an eerie soundtrack

-good voice acting

-the journal pages you find around are well written and eventually shed light on a good story of love, loss and betrayal

[b]CONS:[/b]

-puzzles are extremely easy, their solutions are also often spoon-fed through item descriptions

-very short, expect 45/60 minutes

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=543323853

Belladonna is a mixed bag overall: its story is pretty good and slowly uncovering what happened and who you are by reading through journal pages is an engaging, albeit short-lived, process. Puzzles, on the other hand, are so easy and straightforward that the gameplay suffers as a consequence, there just isn't any challenge.

I do feel the well written story is worth a playthrough though, hence my thumbs up: I'd avoid paying full price due to the basic gameplay and short length but when on sale or in a bundle it's a decent experience, think of it as an interactive gothic short story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009802063', 'num_games_owned': 2871, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1445989447}
review:
Short little point and click adventure. Cute. However, due to its extremely short length, I would hesitate to recommend you pay full price.

Pros:
 * Dark sense of humour. I actually laughed out loud on more than one occasion.
 * Likable protagonist. Well, I liked her anyway. 
 * Interesting story to piece together. Most of the story is told through journal entries.
 * Nice balance of dark scenario and light humour lead to some surprises.

Cons:
 * Very short (it took me just over an hour to complete). Much of that time I felt I was just waiting for the protagonist to walk across the room.
 * The puzzles in the game are perhaps a little too easy.
 * The game crashed out on me once in that time, just before I was entering the final room in the game.
 * If you want the game's trading cards, you need to leave the game open long after it's finished, thanks to a restriction placed by Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041223810', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1445875858}
review: A neat little game. It only took me about an hour to beat (but another five to get Steam trading cards from). The point and click element is fairly straightforward (i.e., easy) but that's not a bad thing in this case. Basically you are playing it for the story. I got this in a bundle of ten games for $4.99. So it was certainly worth the story alone for that price. I'd have a hard time justifying it for the current Steam price of $6.99 though. I'd say the game is a $1.99 price at best given the short length. So wait for sale and then hop on it if you enjoy short gothic tales.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1445844975}
review:
Belladonna is an interesting, albiet short, little puzzle-mystery game where you play as a female frankenstein-type reanimated person with no memory of how or why you ended up the way you are. You explore various parts of the mansion you awoke in, uncovering details of the experiments to reanimate the dead, as well as learning of your own fate and how you came to be. It is a fun mystery puzzle game, though the puzzles are very easy, with the main focus being on the story. As you collect journal entries from around the mansion, you learn more of the story. The game in total took me less than an hour to complete, which was sad, because I wanted more; However, the story was interesting and I liked how the story ultimately turned out. 

Visually, Belladonna is a very simple and basic game, similar to other puzzle games. I was sad the story wasn't longer and more drawn out, but as a game it was fun to play. Just be prepared for a short game if you are thinking of purchasing this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003387111', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1455923319}
review:
This is more of one of those exploration narratives than a point-and-click puzzler. The puzzles that exist are extremely easy and straightforward to the point of feeling almost an inflatiatory cumbersomeness when chasing the narrative. The journal entries uncovered through exploration of the castle hooked me from the start and with better pacing and more content, not only would the progression have felt more natural, but this game would have shined.

Things, however, did go a bit downhill after reaching a certain point of the game. Things should have ended at a particular cut-scene and not continued into the final, macabre fetch quest ultimately leading to an unfulfilling and abrupt ending. All that aside, the journey up to where you hope it's going is good enough for me to recommend it even though it is no masterpiece.

review:

Po przebudzeniu nasza protagonistka stara się przypomnieć sobie kim jest i co się z nią stało, w tym celu odnajdujemy kolejne zapiyski z dzienników doktora, jego żony a na końcu samej Klary. My oczywiście swoje wiemy już znacznie wcześniej, może nie to kim jest (nie od razu ale i tak szybko), miedzy innymi z powodu licznych nawiązań do Frankenstein'a czy to bezpośrednich czy pośrednich.
