author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1445322268}
review:
I'm pretty sure if you woke up on a laboratory table, bolted together from corpse bits, you wouldn't be as peppy as your character in Belladonna. The poor dear takes on the role of the monster in this point & click spin on the tale of Frankenstein, and her sunny outlook isn't the only twist in store. Venturing through the castle, you collect notes from the doctor and his wife, revealing a morbid little story between them. There are a handful of inventory items to scrounge up to solve a smaller handful of puzzles, as well as some awkwardly-voiced dialogue to enjoy.

...And that's it. The game is 30 minutes long. I struggled a bit with whether I thought it was worth it, and in the end I decided it was. The animation is not much past Flash level but the art is clean and the look of the castle is a stark modern gothic that I haven't really seen elsewhere. The twists are interesting, and I like where the story ends up, though the conclusion itself is extremely abrupt. You wouldn't lose much watching a let's play of Belladonna, but it's a fine little adventure game to keep you busy between meatier offerings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062979402', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1444431598}
review:
Belladonna is a point & click adventure game, featuring subtle horror/ Frankenstein-esque atmosphere, beautifully painted backdrops and a sweet, likable protagonist. She wakes up in a laboratory, not knowing who she is or what she is, but exhibits joy of discovery & curiosity rather than fear. Her character traits quickly emerge, like the urge to name things (suit of armor? must be Roland the Poet:) making her the more fleshed out.

The story is quite simple, but still graceful & interesting. We learn most of it by reading torn out journal pages, which are well written & well paced out. Some additional information comes from interacting with objects or looking at things. Her commentaries about the surroundings are quite enjoyable, even if they have nothing to do with the plot itself.

I liked it myself, hence the thumbs up, but it has one major flaw - length. This is very short game. If you read everything carefully and listen to the protagonist's every comment on every subject, you still will finish it under an hour. It's is also quite easy, especially if you pay attention to what is said (the main character will often hint herself as what to do next), so you basically breeze through it, which just intensifies the length problem. 
Also personal & really minor gripe - card settings. I basically finished game 3 times when I hit 2 hour mark and first card dropped, and then I left it idle, but cards seem to be set do drop every half an hour or more, so I had to idle over 5 hour mark to obtain them all, in a game that takes under 1 hour to complete (and that's only if you try hard to prolong the experience).

Overall I liked the atmosphere, the story and the characters. Belladonna is an enjoyable and definitely memorable, albeit short game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198078631236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1443990256}
review:
Интересная история, которая спряталась за point-and-click-квестом.
Минусы – Они незначительны, но есть за что пожурить разработчика. Во-первых, игра очень коротка. Цена соответствующая, но история настолько интересна, что хотелось бы побольше часов геймплея чем от силы час (я жду выпадения всех карточек, поэтому у меня наигранно больше). Во-вторых, в плане сюжета нам выдали очень сырую и скомканную концовку. Она откровенна скучна и не стоит этой игры. Ну и есть три мелочи. Когда делаешь скриншот, то тебя обязательно выбивает в главное меню. Конечно легко вернуться назад, нажав Новая игра, а затем Esc, но механизм вообще странный. Иногда текст в дневниках становится слишком мелким. Ну и для любителей квестов игра наверное противопоказана. Потому что они взвоют от того, насколько лёгкие тут загадки. Квест для тех, кто не любит квесты.
Плюсы – Сюжет. Путь в самом конце он скатывается в неимоверную глупость, и в итоге ты сидишь перед экраном и говоришь «Это всё??», но всё же в течении игры следить за ним весьма и весьма интересно. А подача его через дневники разных персонажей просто превосходна. Сама же главная героиня готова подробно прокомментировать почти каждый интересный для нас объект интерьера. А где хороший сюжет частенько и атмосфера хорошая, верно? Ну по крайней мере, тут именно так. Игра напоминает серию Amnesia, пусть и пытается быть похожей больше на готические романы. Безлюдный замок, заснеженное кладбище, комнаты с покрытой белой тканью мебелью, жуткая лаборатория в подвале, живая оранжерея… Превосходные локации, что ещё сказать. Да и рисовка весьма и весьма симпатичная – напоминает мультфильмы от студии Дисней.
Итог – Если Вы покупаете игру загадок ради, то Вас круто обломают с их лёгкостью в данной игре (главная героиня порой даже прямые подсказки даёт). Но если Вам нравилась вторая игра серии Amnesia за её историю, Вы любите читать дневники персонажей с их душевными терзаниями и готовы пожертвовать геймплеем ради интересной, красивой и немного жуткой истории, то игра для Вас.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053757623', 'num_games_owned': 3175, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1443285505}
review:
Can I reccomend this game? Hmm I guess i can. But get it on sale, I don't think you will be happy buying it on a full price. And that's why.

The game is very short, I've done it in less than 1.5 hours reading all the letters and staring on every scene to enjoy it's beauty. The drawings are great in this game and strangely it seems like different scenes are drawn by different artists, at least 2-3 of them. Dut despite all these beauty it's only like 10 or so scenes in this game which is not much. As for the gameplay it's more like a story-driven waling simulator in a form of an adventure game. Yes it has more than just walking around but believe me it's barely 15-20 usable items in the game so it doesn't make any difference. Also the use of items is very logical which is a plus of course but the minus is you use it immediately very often, few pixels away from the place you found them.

Overall the story is interesting though not very original, game is well-made, art-style is great, diary pages are entertaining ro read but the game is very easy, short and lacks actual gameplay and also the game almost has no ending and looks like devs wanted to make more but decided to just cut the game to the The End screen at some point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042838346', 'num_games_owned': 5513, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1442599160}
review:
Belladonna est un court point & click qui plonge le joueur dans un monde horrifique inspiré du mythe de Frankenstein. 

Vous vous réveillez dans une cave où d'étranges expériences semblent avoir été perpétrées. Vous ne savez pas qui vous êtes ni ce que vous êtes et vous allez devoir explorer la grande demeure qui s'offre à vous pour comprendre les mystères de votre mort et de votre retour à la vie.

Le jeu se présente comme un point & click classique et vous évoluerez dans des décors peints à la main agréables à parcourir bien qu'il n'y aura pas énormément de tableaux différents étant donné la courte durée de vie du jeu. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520395736 Les animations sont un peu plus maladroites et rigides mais rien de bien alarmant. L'atmosphère qui se dégage du jeu est empreinte de mystère et les pages des journaux que l'on ramasse au fur et à mesure de notre progression attestent d'une histoire sordide et glauque. 

Votre aventure est jonchée de beaucoup d'écrits qui comptent pour plus de la moitié de votre temps de jeu. Ces textes ne sont pas disponibles en français et il vaudra mieux avoir un bon niveau d'anglais pour bien comprendre les secrets qu'ils recèlent. La durée de vie du jeu sera donc directement fonction de votre niveau d'anglais et de votre aisance à lire dans cette langue, cela pourra aller d'une à deux heures. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520395777 En tout cas, ce ne sont pas les puzzles qui jalonnent votre parcours qui vous retiendront bien longtemps car ceux-ci sont très simples et peu nombreux.

La [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HPC3OqHV2Qw]musique du jeu est bonne[/url], composée dans un style classique elle reflète bien l'atmosphère froide et énigmatique du jeu. Les doublages sont quant à eux très corrects, à ce niveau là Belladonna s'en tire bien.

Là où Belladonna souffre un peu plus c'est sur de petits détails techniques comme l'absence d'options dans le menu ou l'impossibilité de reprendre la partie (notamment si on tente de prendre une capture d'écran car on est alors renvoyés au menu de démarrage, il est bien sûr rapide de rejouer la partie pour retourner à notre emplacement précédent une fois les textes lus et les énigmes connues mais c'est tout de même embêtant). http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520395813 Pour finir sur un aspect en demi-teinte, la fin du jeu est quelque peu abrupte et laisse perplexe pendant un temps, non pas qu'on ne comprenne pas les tenants et les aboutissants du scénario, tout est limpide ce côté là mais on aurait voulu en voir un peu plus.

Belladonna est clairement un jeu qui n'avait pas beaucoup de budget et qui a quelques failles qu'elles soient techniques ou plutôt dues à sa construction pas assez équilibrée entre lecture et gameplay, il n'en reste pas moins une aventure plaisante certes pas inoubliable mais tout de même sympathique à parcourir de par l'atmosphère lugubre qu'elle dégage et les secrets qu'elle recèle.

[quote]Lisez d'autres avis sur ma page de curation : [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9002662/]Kitsune's Guide[/url][/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000603654', 'num_games_owned': 2418, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1441903803}
review:
Belladona is a really short point & click adventure, an interesting version of the classic Frankenstein story.

The art is somewhat beautiful but they messed up a few things such as that cat tail.

The puzzles are obvious and you don't even need to think to solve them.

The way the game tells you the story is by a series of diary pages that you have to constantly grab and read and that annoys me. The story was interesting till that shit ending.

I definitely wouldn't recommend this game because it's worth reading it, and you might enjoy it, but it's not worth playing it and the asking price for this attempt of game, that lasts less than an hour, is outrageous.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999358714', 'num_games_owned': 2394, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1442016836}
review:
Das Vermischen unterschiedlicher Genres ist eine tolle Sache, die immer mal wieder interessante Ergebnisse mit sich bringt. Es kann zwar auch ziemlicher Mist dabei herauskommen – zum Beispiel wenn Sherlock Holmes plötzlich mit Drachen kämpfen muss (damit ist im Übrigen kein Spiel gemeint, sondern ein literarischer Erguss, auf den ich an dieser Stelle nicht weiter eingehen werde) – doch hin und wieder entstehen echte Hits.

Belladonna basiert auf der Geschichte um Dr. Frankenstein, kombiniert mit Steampunk-Elementen. Man schlüpft in die Rolle einer [b]wiedererweckten Leiche ohne Erinnerung[/b] auf der Suche nach der Wahrheit über die jüngsten Ereignisse im Schloss des Dr. Wolfram.
 Als Spieler muss man hauptsächlich die [b]Geschichte rekonstruieren[/b], indem man überall im Haus verstreut herumliegende Tagebucheinträge sammelt. Das macht erstaunlich viel Spaß; der Reiz, aus den aus verschiedenen Perspektiven erzählten Begebenheiten die wahren Geschehnisse zu entnehmen, ist enorm hoch. Die Texte sind wundervoll geschrieben, man fühlt sich oft an die klassische Literatur erinnert.

Dies ist allerdings auch die einzige Denkleistung, die man für Belladonna erbringen muss. Die [b]Rätsel sind allesamt so offensichtlich[/b], dass sie den Namen kaum verdient haben. Noch dazu ist die Anzahl der betretbaren Wohnräume und vorhandenen Gegenstände überschaubar. Wer nach kniffligen Aufgaben sucht ist hier falsch, der Fokus liegt klar auf der erzählten Geschichte.
Auch viele weitere Aspekte des Spiels wissen zu begeistern: die [b]handgezeichneten 2D-Hintergründe sehen fantastisch aus[/b], meiner Meinung nach sogar besser als die großer Adventurehersteller wie Daedalic. Lediglich der Stil der Protagonisten ist deutlich klarer und undetaillierter ausgefallen und sticht somit etwas negativ heraus. Die Musik ist top und besonders in Schlüsselszenen perfekt eingesetzt; die Sounds können sich ebenfalls sehen lassen.
Ein großes Manko gibt es jedoch: das Ende kommt schnell und abrupt. [b]Viel länger als eine Stunde braucht man zu Komplettierung nicht[/b]. Es kommt einem so vor, als hätten die Entwickler selbst nicht gewusst, wie man die Geschichte zu einem vernünftigen Abschluss bringen kann. Hat man alle Tagebuchseiten gesammelt, folgt ein etwas längeres Gespräch, man löst ein Rätsel und wird prompt von einem „The End“-Bild überrascht. Dann sitzt man minutenlang paralysiert vom Rechner und fragt sich ob das ein Scherz sein soll.

Nun ja, man kann nicht alles haben. Vom perfekten Spiel ist Belladonna hauptsächlich aufgrund der [b]Kürze[/b] und des [b]abrupten Endes[/b], das es unfertig wirken lässt, noch entfernt. Die [b]fantastische Geschichte[/b] ist Grund genug ihm eine Chance zu geben. Und selbst wenn es einem nicht gefällt, vergeudet man im schlimmsten Falle doch nur sehr kurze Zeit...

author: {'steamid': '76561198038106467', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1441579431}
review: Un titolo molto promettente tanto inconsistente. Innanzitutto non è un gioco, ma un libro "interattivo". Il 90% del gioco, che tra l'altro dura un oretta scarsa, riguarda leggere pagine di un diario. Ritengo che lo sviluppatore abbia una certa capacità narrativa e inventiva ma che il mezzo videoludico sia completamente fuori dalle sue corde. Evidentemente ha agito con cinico calcolo economico. Un romanzo avrebbe richiesto molte, molte più pagine, comportato molti più rischi e probabilmente meno introiti. In sintesi questo gioco è una truffa. Non vale più 1 euro ! Quindi, sconsigliatissimo !!!! Piuttosto compratevi Frankeinstein di Mary Shelley e leggetevi quello.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042773412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1441548160}
review:
Krótko i na temat: Kliknąłem "Nie polecam" ze względu na stanowczo zbyt wysoką cenę gry. 7€ za produkcję starczającą na ~1h to stanowczo zbyt wysoka cena. Tym bardziej że to prosta przygodówka i po jej przejściu nie czujemy potrzeby przejścia jej raz jeszcze - wszystko dane nam będzie ujrzeć przy pierwszym przejściu gry,
Jeśli jednak cena Ci odpowiada, masz zamiar kupić tą grę w jakimś bundlu, lub jeszcze lepiej w dostać w jakiejś promocji za darmo, wówczas jak najbardziej warto zagrać.

Mając za sobą wyjaśnienie pora na nieco więcej szczegółów.

Belladonna to gra typu Point&Click czyli przygodówka w której sterujemy naszą postacią i rozwiązujemy wszystkie zagadki za pomocą prostych kliknięć myszką w odpowiednie przedmioty. Już na wstępie jednak wypada mi ponownie zaznaczyć że jest to bardzo króciutka gierka, więc jeśli zależy Ci na kilkunastu godzinach rozgrywki to niestety nic z tego. Gra starcza na jakąś godzinę.
W grze wcielamy się w kobiecą postać, która natychmiast kojarzy się nam z Frankensteinem i tym razem nie jest to w żadnym wypadku zły trop. Po tym jak obudzimy się w labolatorium jako nieumarłe monstrum, naszym zadaniem jest ustalić to kim jesteśmy, kto powołał nas do życia i jaki jest nasz dalszy cel istnienia, a odpowiedzi na te pytania wywalczymy sobie za pomocą rozwiązywania zagadek w pewnej posiadłości i jej okolicach. Niestety albo i stety, zagadki jakie przyjdzie nam rozwiązać są... naprawdę proste. Żadna z zagadek nie zajęła mi więcej niż minutę czy dwie myślenia. Proste łączenie przedmiotów, obserwacja otoczenia i tyle, utknąć tu byłoby naprawdę trudno. Dla jednych to zapewne plus, ale dla mnie, czyli osoby która przeszła dziesiątki klasycznych przygodówek, prezentowany tutaj poziom był po prostu za niski i nie odczułem nawet najmniejszej satysfakcji z rozwiązania którejkolwiek z zagadek.
Jeśli chodzi o prezencje Audio-Wizualną - tu jest akurat całkiem nieźle. Grafika to dość proste rysunki 2d, jednak mają swój niewątpliwy urok i ciekawy dość abstrakcyjny styl. Wszystkie przedmioty z którymi możemy wejść w interakcje, dość dobrze się wyróżniają przez co większość z lokacji zobaczymy tylko z 2-3 razy jako że więcej nie będziemy musieli się cofać by znaleźć przedmiot który pominęliśmy.
Muzyka w grze jest niespecjalna. Nie przeszkadza ale i nie zapada w pamięć. Efekty dźwiękowe są jak najbardziej ok i wszystko brzmi w sumie tak jak powinno, nie ma na co narzekać. Za to swoistą gwiazdą audio jak i zresztą całej gry jest głos naszej bohaterki, przyjemny dla ucha, odpowiednio modulowany w zależności od sytuacji czy sprawdzanego przedmiotu i co najważniejsze jest w tym wszystkim odrobina humoru. Niestety już tego samego poziomu nie prezentuje druga postać z którą przyjdzie nam zamienić kilka słów.

Po za tym o grze nie ma się specjalnie co rozpisywać. Klasyczny Point&Click ze świetnie zdubbingowaną postacią naszej głównej bohaterki. Odrobina zbierania porozrzucanych stron dzienników dla fanów dodatkowej warstwy fabularnej, po za tym naprawdę banalne łamigłówki i tyle. Mniej więcej godzina całkiem przyjemnej zabawy, ale nic ponad to niestety.
Jeśli po tych słowach uważasz że gra najpewniej przypadnie Ci do gustu, to śmiało, nie zawiedziesz się, no chyba że długością samej gry, w przeciwnym wypadku... Śmiało omiń tą produkcję nie tracisz wiele ;)

Pozdrawiam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072553411', 'num_games_owned': 906, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1451146618}
review:
(Note: I got this game for free, so I may have a different view then someone who bought it full price. Also some minor spoilers.)

Belladonna is a game that revolves around 3 characters:
- The Scientist (I can't remember his name, so I'll call him Scientist Dude)
- Belladonna (The Scientist's wife)
- Klara (Belladonna's maid)
The introduction is that Scientist Dude and his wife Belladonna live in this big mansion place, the wife has a son (Lucas) that dies soon after birth. Scientist Dude and his wife start becoming distant, with Scientist Dude always in the basement and his wife always upstairs staring out a window. The mansion starts falling apart, with many of the servants quitting, until only one is left, Klara. Klara and Belladonna have a thing for each other. Scientist Dude has learned the secrets of reanimation (Frankenstein stuff).

What I enjoyed about this game:
- the art style
- the music
- the chilling/spooky parts (even though you can always tell when one of these is about to happen because normally the screen shifts automatically while you move but these parts it doesn't until you get close to the edge and the area obviously has more to it that it isn't showing immediately)
- the idea in the story of same-sex romance (which is rarely featured in games)
- the idea in the story of clockwork reanimated people
- The attention to detail in some parts, (Spoiler here!) [spoiler]after you collect all the parts for reanimating the dead scientist, the stairs leading to the basement get a bloodstain on them, suggesting Belladonna dragged the body down the steps.[/spoiler]  
- How you have to figure out the story for yourself, as not much is revealed to you without collecting the journal pages. I also liked how the end of the story is revealed first, then everything leading up to that point.

What I didn't enjoy about this game:
- The majority of the voice acting. It seems forced, usually without emotions. (especially the very first lines. They are really weak and made me want to stop playing in the first 30 seconds). Occasionally there is obvious cuts that don't sound too good.
- The attention to detail in some other parts. (Spoiler here, again!) [spoiler]when i was told to collect the things to reanimate the scientist, I didn't ask any questions at first because I THOUGHT I knew where everything was. After collecting the brain, your character says something about having all the parts, even though I had not found all of them yet.[/spoiler]
- The shortness of the game. I could see why someone who bought this game for full value might be a bit frustrated.
- With the shortness mentioned, I hated the ending. It was abrupt, and I felt like alot more could be said. There is a difference between a suspensful cliffhanger that keeps you guessing but still satisfies (think Inception) and an ending that is so sudden that it literally gives you a picture of what ends up happening, which is what this game did. The last thing happens, and the 'The End' screen shows a single picture that defines the future, no making up stuff allowed!

In the end, I have to say I did enjoy this game, although it should have been longer and not had such a rushed, sudden, and unimaginative ending. The highest I could give this is a 6/10, but I feel like most would settle for less, especially paying full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975593715', 'num_games_owned': 2290, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1438785927}
review:
***Disclaimer: Copy provided by the developer***

Point-and-click adventures were a dead genre. And not unlike the protagonist of [i]Belladonna[/i], they didn’t stay dead forever. In a sea of modern adventures that eschew traditional puzzles in favor of character development and moral choices, I was interested in tackling a traditional point-and-click adventure game. Especially one with a horror aesthetic.

[i]Belladonna’s[/i] influences become obvious very early on. We start our game on a slab in a laboratory, suffering from amnesia, of course. We are a reanimated corpse and our goal is to piece together the events that lead to our initial demise. So you can see how Mary Shelley’s [i]Frankenstein[/i] plays a key role in the creation of this game, even before the game clumsily makes a reference to her within the first five minutes.

The laboratory we’re in happens to be housed inside the dungeon of a castle, occupied by Dr. Wolfram von Trauerschloss. Now if that name doesn’t sound silly to you, it’s probably because you don’t speak German, because “Trauerschloss” literally translates to “Mourning Castle”. So you can see why this was one of the early warning signs about this title, for me at least. The good doctor, true to his inspiration, tinkers with the elements of life to bring back recently deceased organisms. 

Unfortunately, we don’t really see him do that. You see, [i]Belladonna[/i] is more of an investigative story than one we’re directly involved with. We’re here to run around the castle, looking for clues and objects to solve puzzles and uncover what actually happened. That means, we’ll be collecting a handful of journal entries that explain to us the events and character motivations. It’s a rather clumsy attempt at delivering a story, mostly relying on exposition instead of actual story development. The problem with this however is, besides being a rather weak writing tool, that a lot of what we’re reading easily foreshadows upcoming revelations. This makes the story seem to be a paint-by-numbers affair, which it actually is, and does little to engage the player. 

This is only further exacerbated by the fact that almost every interaction with this world seems to yield a “funny” response from our main character. The game obviously follows the example made by the old LucasArts games, but unfortunately it undermines the gothic horror atmosphere the rest of the game wants to invoke. And the reason I put “funny” in quotation marks is because the humor constantly falls flat. Besides, this isn’t a funny story, none of the elements are amusing at all. This is a story about personal loss, about tragedy, interpersonal relationships, envy and madness. Disconnected, sarcastic humor doesn’t really fit well when contrasted with the serious nature of its themes.

This wouldn’t be a problem in most other games where gameplay is king, but unfortunately, adventure games rarely contain any gameplay outside of inventory management. If I’ve counted correctly, there are maybe 4 or 5 puzzles you have to solve, most of which have solutions that are immediately obvious to anyone playing. Inventory management is very basic, you can combine two objects in order to solve puzzles with the resulting combinations. And if that weren’t enough, the constant vocalizations of our protagonist makes the solutions even more obvious. We’re rarely required to get creative or think outside the box.

The only aspect that registered positively with me was the visual presentation. We find ourselves in a lovingly designed, very detailed environment that manages to give the game some semblance of a gothic horror atmosphere. And the music helps to underline that. But unfortunately, this is largely undone by the aforementioned tonal discrepancies between the world we’re in and the theoretical gravitas of the story, and the lighthearted nature of the simplistically written dialogue. 

Now some of you might be perplexed by the low number of puzzles presented to us and ask how long this journey through [i]Belladonna[/i] actually takes. And to be perfectly blunt, it takes less than an hour and 30 minutes. It’s a very short affair with no secrets, and the fact that the story is entirely linear also means that there’s literally no replay value. 

So at this point, the only thing I can say is that, in spite of its beautiful visuals and nice soundtrack, the game unfortunately doesn’t manage to capture the charm of popular point-and-click adventure games. The story would’ve had potential if it would’ve focused more on the more polarizing and grotesque elements in there, but in this state, you’re probably better off watching the Universal version of [i]Frankenstein[/i]. Or if you like a bit more humor in your horror, why not go for [i]Re-Animator[/i] instead? Because in the end, you’re about as passive in [i]Belladonna[/i] as you are while watching a movie.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995105285', 'num_games_owned': 6098, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1438659594}
review:
I'm sorry to say that I can't really recommend Belladonna. This is a short point and click adventure game about a woman who wakes up reanimated in a dungeon and has to figure out what happened to her. Most of the story is told in journal entries that your character finds throughout the castle. The story in these is interesting (if pretty scary and tragic) and told well, but the fonts chosen for each character are quite small and can be hard to read. It's a bit of a weakness that the player character has amnesia, since her relationship to the other characters is difficult to flesh out because she doesn't remember them. There's one particularly disturbing story thread that kind of ends up going nowhere for this reason. 

The puzzles are simple and logical for the most part. The only time I had slight difficulty progressing was when I couldn't find an object at the edge of a scene. Veteran adventure gamers will likely find the puzzles too easy, but for people just starting out in adventure games they'll work well. The art is simple but clean for the most part. In some places it's a bit difficult to figure out which objects can be interacted with. The voice acting is decent, and it was nice to hear so many object descriptions.

I liked most of the time that I spent with this game, but it's just too short and its themes, while interesting, are left too unresolved to be able to recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069420601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1490494772}
review:
[u]This review has been updated to reflect improvements and fixes that the devs have implemented since I first played the game. (At the end of the review I've added a note of what has been fixed).[/u]

[h1]Overview[/h1]
I have mixed views on Belladonna. On one hand the story is dark and intriguing and has pretty solid voice acting, but on the other it does not explore these themes in enough depth to make a lasting impression. I think this game is worth trying if you already got it on sale or in a bundle. My completion time was 1.5 hours, and the remaining time on my counter was for trading card drops.

[h1]Thoughts, story wise[/h1]
Belladonna explores some dark and mature themes, including life, death, murder and other moral issues. The game follows an animated corpse as she tries to find out about her past life and how she came to be in this state between being alive and dead. The dark and macabre nature of the story was interesting to me, and will interest those who are also fans of this type of story. I did enjoy unraveling the mysteries behind Belladonna as the story progresses, and some of the twisted revelations throughout the game I did find satisfying.

There are several shortcomings to this game, however, that prevented me from enjoying it as much as I felt I would. The story simply is too short and doesn't explore enough of the dark themes, and felt like a wasted potential. Play time isn't always the most important thing if there is enough emotional impact, but Belladonna felt very rushed at times, for example as some other reviews have mentioned, notably so near the ending.

[h1]Thoughts, game play wise[/h1]
Belladonna is certainly a point and click adventure game, but within this genre people do have different expectations. I would describe Belladonna as more as a story-exploration game with adventure game elements, that is the focus is more on the story while the puzzles are not very difficult, and do not take up much time. I personally do not mind this as there are other games I could play if I wanted a challenge, so as long you're not expecting some super difficult brain teasers you shouldn't be disappointed in this aspect.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
I enjoyed the story of Belladonna, but felt there could have been much more to the game. If you enjoy dark, macabre stories and don't mind easy point and click puzzles, I think this game is worth picking up on sale or in a bundle, but no need to go out of your way to do so.

[u]* Edited out previous inability to take Steam screenshots and broken save system. These two issues have since been fixed. There may or may not be achievements added, but the dev hasn't really 100% promised anything.[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198036790112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1469072942}
review:
Недаром на одном из промо-постеров Belladonna написано "Некоторые тайны следует похоронить. И некоторых женщин тоже*". В этой игре слов идеально передан основной смысл истории: знакомые большинству из нас чувства и пороки - любовь, страсть, ненависть, гордыня, страх, отчаяние - порой заставляют людей делать ужасные вещи.

Начинается всё с того, что мёртвая девушка, как полагается без имени и памяти, приходит в себя и, кажется, перестаёт быть мёртвой. Судя по внешнему виду, сшита она на манер монстра Франкештейна из частей тел, а в голове у неё вращается заводной ключ. Предоставленная сама себе, девушка начинает изучать окружающую действительность в поисках ответов на многочисленные вопросы и постепенно восстанавливает цепочку произошедших событий. Причём событий одновременно и жутких, и забавных - наверняка автор и идеолог проекта Никлас Халлин вдохновлялся не только совсем уж мрачными готическими романами (пламенный привет Мэри Шелли), незнакомыми современным двоечникам, но и более доступными широкой публике образами, вроде сумасшедшей кукольной мультипликации того же Тима Бёртона. Да и положа руку на сердце, в процессе прохождения Belladonna воспринимаешь отнюдь не привычной приключенческой point&click-игрой. Скорее своеобразным анимационным фильмом с великолепным художественным исполнением, в котором позволяют покликать мышкой по интерьерам.

Нельзя забывать, что сюжет здесь существует сразу в двух агрегатных состояниях. Главная героиня исследует старинный особняк и активно делится своими соображениями и мыслями с нами, а временами даёт подсказки. Между тем на пути то и дело встречаются страницы дневника - их в обязательном порядке следует собрать и прочитать от корки до корки, чтобы понять предысторию (благо ничего сложного тут нет, записки аккуратно разложены на самых видных местах). И вот тогда история сложится из кубиков в цельное произведение, а мотивация и поступки персонажей встанут на свои места.

Единственное, за что хочется пожурить создателя, так это за небольшой хронометраж, чересур простые головоломки и несколько скомканную концовку. При неспешном прохождении игра заканчивается примерно через час реального времени. А ведь этого очень мало и просто напросто хочется продолжать пропитываться атмосферой готической сказки! Стоит Belladonna смешных денег, но лучше бы она была в два или три раза дороже, но длиннее. Хотя требовать невозможного от человека, работавшего практически в одиночку, не стоит. Да и сказка на то и сказка, чтобы помочь скоротать время перед сном.

А вторая и третья "проблемы" плавно вытекают из первой. Загадки логичны и прямолинейны, с ними справится даже начинающий игрок, только ступающий на тропу интерактивных приключений. Но в конкретном случае Neckbolt можно позволить некую безумную выходку, сеттинг обязывает. А вот с финалом сложнее: на мой взгляд, выбор очаровательная покойница сделала как-то слишком легко и непринуждённо, даже не по себе становится.

Хотя кто знает, что там в голове у этих кадавров...

http://www.vgblogs.ru/2015/03/belladonna-mnenie.html

Дисклеймер: ревью-код

author: {'steamid': '76561198076606506', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1428873805}
review:
Belladonna ist ein lustiges (MEGA- ) kleines Point-and-click Abenteuer.

Graphik 6.5 von 10
Die Grafik ist im Comic-Stil gehalten und nicht so besonders oder beeindruckend. Aber trotzdem passend zum Spiel

Musik 7 von 10 
Die Musik ist passend und stimmig und unterstreicht das Spiel gut

Gameplay 7 von 10 
Klassisches Point-and-Click Spiel , Sammle Gegenstände und kombiniere sie um Tür X zu öffnen.. Gut gelungen .Nichts überraschendes dabei , aber solide Kost.

Story 7.5 von 10
Die Geschichte ist gut . Sehr unterhaltsam . Ihr wacht als Leiche auf und müsst herausfinden wer ihr seit und warum ihr noch am Leben seit.... Dazu könnt ihr verschieden Journaleinträge oder Tagebuchseiten im Schloß verstreut finden und somit dieses Rätsel nach und nach lösen .Sehr stimmig erzählt und auch der Humor kommt nicht zu kurz. So im Tim Burton Style .Stellenweise grotesk ..doch immer auch etwas humorvoll.

Fazit 7 von 10 
Das Spiel ist ein solides , gelungenes Point-and-Click Adventure . Leider ist es etwas kurz geraten ( ca 1 std und ihr seit durch ) . Leider hat es bei mir aus irgendeinem Grund die Achievements nicht freigeschalten .Naja, aber lustig wars trotzdem .Teuer ist es ja nicht , ich dem Spiel mal ne Chance geben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042261571', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1428200870}
review:
While this is one of the shortest point and click games I've played, this one made me very disappointed it wasn't longer. It was simple, but don't fix what ain't broke.

There is an atmosphere of dread that is captured very well with the music, art, and voice acting. The story, while somewhat predictable after a few diary pages, was still chilling enough that I found myself cringing and being disgusted with every action I took. My character's questioning of her own actions and morals gave me a nice feeling of just how much this was inspired by Mary Shelley's work.

It was an appropriate love letter to Frankenstein. It really was.

Yet there are some things I should add that are huge, glaring downfalls in this game. The big reveal cutscene after dealing with the cat (UH. THANKS FOR THAT, BY THE WAY!) seems a bit awkward. The one character no longer seems to fit in with the artstyle of Belladonna and just looks out of place. We have all of this lovely art and...what? Yet this is easily overlooked. It's not very long and you'll get back to PRETTY! 2D! soon enough.

The largest concern is this game is ENTIRELY TOO SHORT. You will get to the end, not realize it, and reach the THE END screen and start bemoaning how this game deserved much longer. You're expecting the next phase of the game to begin, especially since your character seems to be wanting to voice her concerns, but...nothing! The puzzles, being simple enough as they are, make it feel as if this game needed much more time devoted to it.

Those are my gripes. Was it worth the $6.99 I paid? Probably not. Was it a good experience? Enough to write some cheesy fanfiction because you ripped my heart out.

...Well that's very appropriate given we're reanimating corpses here, huh?

review: I appreciate the intent of this game. Few titles dare to look at the issues of domestic abuse or a protagonist in a same-sex romance. But it didn't succeed in its execution. The characters don't leave any lasting impressions (the central characters, despite being in a relationship, show no real emotion towards one another), too much of the story is told through journal entries rather than having revelations occur naturally, and the conclusion is very lackluster. Some impressive concepts were brought up, esp. the concern of whether or not those brought back lacked souls/humanity, but this question was just abandoned without any further discussion. Additionally, the puzzles are too simplistic, with no real challenge or sense of achievement. Belladonna would have worked better as a short animation than as an interactive story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997172478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1013, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1438682387}
review:
[h1]About Creepy Ciao Bella[/h1]
This is the perfect game for those who want to start the adventure genre. Other games in this genre can be too difficult (from their puzzles), too long or too crazy (from their stories), but "Belladonna" is very well written, has some logic puzzles, nice characters and backgrounds. It is an ideal sample.

On the other hand, for adventure game veterans this game may seem too short (about an hour of gameplay) so it bites the fact of a little missed opportunity to add more environments, implement more puzzles, characters and dialogues. 
But after all, this game was made by one person - Niklas Hallina. So that explains the length of the game.

Despite the fact that this game is short and too easy for those who eat adventure games for breakfast "Belladonna" is very unique - the style, and the appearance of the main character - she is neither good nor bad and this adds some depth to the overall feeling.

Oh, and one more thing - the developer himself wrote somewhere on his website that his work is largely modeled not on other games, but on literature. I can say that this really feels, especially when reading pages torn from the diaries of "Belladonnay."

All in all, I highly recommend this game for people who appreciate atmosphere, characters and stories in any game. And those who only like long game and difficult puzzles may be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137008785', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1455490892}
review:
(Possibly spoiler-y?)
I took a chance on this game, being newly released today, usually I don't purchase games I've never heard of but I couldn't resist the beautiful-yet-simplistic art style.  
The music and art style is probably the most enjoyable aspect of the game, and if you like Adventure Game Studio-style games you'll want to check this out. The story has a little room to be expanded on, and it would be nice if it had been a little longer than the barely an hour it took for me to play it (I was not rushing). 
This is, in my opinion, an art game.  

Those who enjoyed games like Dear Esther and Gone Home will enjoy the story.  The gameplay is mostly straightforward and relies on the player investing personal interest in the story between the characters.   The voice acting is good, though I could see some being frustrated at the fact that many of the longer sections of text had no voice over.

Overall, I don't regret the purchase despite the price for such a short game, and would recommend it to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007928072', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1424908988}
review:
In a very basic nutshell Belladonna is a fun, although short point&click adventure experience.
http://youtu.be/gel7-YrL4P0

The story, without spoiling too much, takes place in a old seemingly abandoned castle somewhere in Europe.
You wake up in the castles basement surrounded by ghoulish scientific experiments and you soon realize to be one of those experiments. A living corpse basically.

As you suffer from videogame amnesia, not really surprising considering that you have clockwork machine in you're head and being dead, you must explore the castle to find out what took place there.

Gameplay is what you would expect from a point and click. Point. Click.
The game will have you to also combine items you find in the level as one would expect.
Some puzzles are present, but they are not that challenging.

The story is nothing special, but it is enjoyable and I found myself to wanting to know more on what's going on in the castle. Although there's one part of the game which a lot of people on the internet will hate, I know I did :'(
The visuals are very well made and really help to set the mood in to the game.

If you like point and clicks I see no reason on not getting this, well it is a bit short so do keep that in mind.
